For easy problems, the model selects short target lengths; for medium problems, it gradually decreases from higher initial values; and for hard problems, it maintains consistently high target lengths near the context window limit. This demonstrates the methods‚Äô ability to adaptively allocate computational resources based on problem complexity, unlike fixed-length approaches.
